alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 6:52PM CDT until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines and St. Bernard. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Greatest rainfall totals with highest likelyhood of localized flooding is across the Gretna to Terrytown area - with a radar estimated rain total of around 1.5 to 2 inches since 3:30PM CT. Elsewhere, localized ponding/water on roadways remains likely across areas of poor drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Harvey, Timberlane, Marrero, Chalmette, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Terrytown, Arabi, Bridge City and Elmwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
